er: #japanese
alright. given lack of familiarity with kernel updates here, guess I'll wander off. later y'all
no, a new kernel is not available as a package for Edgy. it is for Feisty
there's absolutely no guarantees that the Feisty kernel will work on Edgy - actually, chances are it won't. see perhaps in #ubuntu+1 if someone has ever tried that
sooo, feisty is the Ubuntu-speek for unstable branch?
currently, yes
that's the sorta stuff that bugs me. his machine is using a lot of wierd stuff
Nvidia graphics card, ethernet card and network card
ethernet card and network card? =)
some stupid nvidia invention.  I think it is like a combo chip
He's using an eMachine I picked up for 300 bucks
oh. well anyway, if the Ubuntu install is a fresh install with nothing important on it, i guess you've got nothing to lose by just trying and sticking the Feisty kernel on it
I'm remote.  I really can't screw up his machine from 4000km away
hm, i see. well, i can positively say that there's no kernel package newer than 2.6.17 that's anywhere near guaranteed to work with Edgy, sorry
Aight, so I'll tell him his choices are to have USB die randomly 'till April, or take a chance on unstable
or do a kernel compile, i guess
yeah, but that one would almost certainly kill his networking and video
and require updating more than I want to try doing from here
well, just keep in mind that Feisty *is* unstable, meaning that it's quite possible for updates to break little things like X
due to the unstable thing I'm also worried about more esoteric drivers like his not making it out, immediately.
one more thing, being new to ubuntu.  once Feisty is released, will auto-updating be possible, or will it require manual changes or a CD?
there's an updater tool (changing the repos manually is not quite recommended... can be done, but sometimes it breaks things)
thanks. alrighty. good enough for now. later y'all
